title: Artichoke & Olive Omelet
description: A tender three-egg omelet filled with tangy marinated artichoke hearts, briny Kalamata olives and melty feta. Quick skillet cooking yields a silky interior and lightly golden exterior — brightened with lemon and fresh herbs.

ingredients.display_name: marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
kalamata or black olives, pitted and sliced

ingredients.notes: for lightly sautéeing shallot (can omit if using all butter)

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: drain and roughly chop artichoke hearts, pit and slice olives, crumble feta, mince shallot, chop parsley, and juice the lemon.
In a bowl, beat the eggs with milk, a pinch of salt and pepper until blended and slightly frothy to incorporate air for a tender omelet.
Heat a 8-10 inch nonstick skillet over medium heat and add half the butter and the olive oil; swirl to coat. Sauté the minced shallot just until softened and translucent, about 45 seconds.
Add the chopped artichokes and sliced olives to the pan, toss briefly to warm and release aromas, about 45 seconds; remove mixture to a small bowl and wipe the pan if there is excess oil.
Return pan to medium-low heat and melt remaining butter so it coats the skillet. Pour in the beaten eggs and let them set at the edges without stirring for about 30–45 seconds.
Using a spatula, gently push set edges toward the center and tilt pan to allow uncooked egg to flow underneath; repeat until top is mostly set but still slightly moist, about 60–90 seconds.
Evenly distribute the warmed artichoke-olive mixture and crumbled feta onto one half of the omelet, sprinkle with chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Fold the omelet in half over the filling and let cook for another 30–45 seconds to melt the cheese and finish cooking; avoid overcooking to keep a silky interior.
Slide the omelet onto a plate, taste and adjust seasoning with a small pinch of salt and freshly ground pepper, garnish with extra parsley and serve immediately.
